text: OnePlus has been on somewhat of an update frenzy lately, bringing its OxygenOS 15 based on Android 15 to many devices left and right. Today it's the original OnePlus Pad's turn to be blessed with the latest software version. The tablet launched in 2023 is getting the update in India only at the moment, but it will reach Europe and North America next week. As usual in these cases, the update is rolling out in batches, so even if you are in India you may not receive the notification right away. Once you install the update your OnePlus Pad will be on software version OPD2203_15.0.0.301(EX01). As always with OxygenOS 15 updates, the changelog is huge, so if you want to sift through all of it we recommend visiting the Source linked below. We'll just mention a few bits that stood out to us: ultra animation effects, AI Detail Boost and AI Reflection Eraser for photos, a new AI writing suite with continue writing, polish, optimize style, format, and clean up features, a new rounded corner design, new themes, globally reversible photo editing, better integration of filters into the Camera app, new floating window gestures, added Split mode for notifications and Quick Settings, redesigned Quick Settings, and the ability to share to iOS devices. html:
OnePlus has been on somewhat of an update frenzy lately, bringing its OxygenOS 15 based on Android 15 to many devices left and right. Today it's the original OnePlus Pad's turn to be blessed with the latest software version.

The tablet launched in 2023 is getting the update in India only at the moment, but it will reach Europe and North America next week. As usual in these cases, the update is rolling out in batches, so even if you are in India you may not receive the notification right away. Once you install the update your OnePlus Pad will be on software version OPD2203_15.0.0.301(EX01).

As always with OxygenOS 15 updates, the changelog is huge, so if you want to sift through all of it we recommend visiting the Source linked below.

We'll just mention a few bits that stood out to us: ultra animation effects, AI Detail Boost and AI Reflection Eraser for photos, a new AI writing suite with continue writing, polish, optimize style, format, and clean up features, a new rounded corner design, new themes, globally reversible photo editing, better integration of filters into the Camera app, new floating window gestures, added Split mode for notifications and Quick Settings, redesigned Quick Settings, and the ability to share to iOS devices.

Source
